VARDESC: Social Exclusion: People have physically backed away from me because I have SCD.
Social Exclusion: As a rule, telling others that I have SCD has been a mistake.
Social Exclusion: People seem to be afraid of me because I have SCD.
Internalized Stigma: I feel guilty because I have SCD.
Internalized Stigma: Having SCD makes me feel that I am a bad person.
Internalized Stigma: I feel I am not as good as others because I have SCD.
Disclosure Concerns: In many areas of my life, no one knows that I have SCD.
Disclosure Concerns: I am very careful who I tell that I have SCD.
Disclosure Concerns: Telling someone I have SCD is risky.
Expected Discrimination: People lose jobs when employers learn they have SCD.
Expected Discrimination: I worry about people discriminating against me because I have SCD.
